description: This course covers a wide range of approaches to trans (from gender identity, gender expression, to trans as a method and a theory). Students examine a number of topics including: definitions and language; the binary gender system and its effects on trans life; the history of the trans movement; the legal, social, and medical aspects of transition; transnational perspectives of trans experience; decolonial approaches to trans experience; and socio-political issues of trans life. Offered periodically.
name: Introduction to Trans Studies
